It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glandular-dotted. It produces蓇葖 fruits that release seeds with silky parachutes, aiding in wind dispersal.
